intro: Rhamphidia elongata, commonly known as the long-fruited rhamphidia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. It is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers, which are typically followed by elongated, tubular fruits. Rhamphidia elongata is native to parts of Africa and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. It is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
